text: Sampled from a 750 ml bottle shared by someone at Listermann. Pours black in color with a small khaki colored head. The aroma and flavor are as advertised, chocolate, coffee, cinnamon, vanilla, toffee, hints of wood, sweet, dessert like, not as full bodied as some of the Angry Chair stouts Ive had, good.
UPDATED: MAY 14, 2017 Dark black. Sweet. Real buttery. Cocoa. Cinnamon. Thick. Nice dessert stout.

(On tap @ CBC 2016 Yellow Session, Copenhagen) Pours pitch black with a dark tan head. Nose is extraordinarily dessert-like and unctuous, very tiramisu-like in character. Really rich coffee, a bit of almond, Amaretto notes, dark unsweetened chocolate, caramel drizzle, pretty intense. Flavour is more balanced, not extraordinarily sugary malt. Lots of coffee, coffee liqueur, amaretto, nutty notes, very measured overall, hints of cookie dough. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Hits the tiramisu marks nicely, and the sweetness coming up more on the nose than the tongue enhances drinkability. Good dessert in a glass.
Dont get as much tiramisu as I wouldve wanted, but its there and pretty nice! Not overly sweet, but instead well balanced. Flavours of milk chocolate, coffee, cinnamon and almond. Nice!

May 13, 2016. On tap at CBC, yellow session. 
Black with a small brown head. Aroma is sweet and soft roasted with dark chocolate, creamy espresso, caramel, vanilla, cinnamon and soft nutty with almonds. Taste is sweet, malty smooth bitter. Full bodied, oily creamy texture, soft carbonation. Finish is smooth, creamy and sweet with caramel, vanilla, dark chocolate notes with a soft bitterness.
Great decadent dessert stout.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Tiramisu w płynie!

Draught. Dark brown coloured. Unclear. Brown dense head. ARoma. Coffee, roast, some sweetness, cocoa, dark chocolate, caramle. Flavour. Sweet chocolate, cocoa, coffee, caramel, roast, some molasses, vanilla and vaguel liqourice. Medium to full bodied. Ends rosted bitterr with some chocolaty sweetness.

Draught @ CBC 2016 [ Yellow Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, Oksnehallen Vesterbro, Halmtorvet 11, 1700 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Angry Chair Tiramisu ].Clear dark brown color with a small average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, coffee, dusty coffee, coffee vegatables. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, chocolate, dusty coffee, sweet malt, vanilla, rich chocolate, light alcohol - rum. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160513]
From tap at CBC 2016. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of cacao, roasted malt, coffee, oak, cinnamon, rum and vanilla.
Sample @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Black body with a small light brown head. Roasted malt, molasses, chocolate, oak, cocoa powder, bourbun.

Aroma is coffee, cognac, some mild wooden notes as well as spices and chocolate. Flavour is liquorice, coffee, roasted notes, mild cognac and rum as well as some vanilla and mild alcohol sweetness.
Bottle. Sweet brown sugar bouquet. Well, it taste like Tiramisu mixed with tasty dark roasted malts. Good body and mouthfeel.

750 mL bottle. Pours a sugary-looking black. Leggy swirl. Smells of vanilla, coffee, and a little cinnamon. Sugary, too. Tastes of all adjuncts. Vanilla, a little coffee, and cinnamon spice in the back. Heavy chocolate and fudge throughout. Very sweet. Heavy body. All these Angry Chair stouts are so sweet. Difficult to drink for me.

750ml bottle via fishingnet. Thanks a bunch, Ben. These have been knocking it out of the park. A deep thicker opaque blackish dark chocolate hue is ominous, deep, and midnight tinged. A firmer dark brown head is sizable, frothy and firm with a nice thicker ringer and subtle film sitting atop. Solid lacing, creamy, dark, inviting. Aromas are chocolatey, caramel and silky dark. Creamy, earthy, creme and chocolate mousse. A subtle nuttiness, firmer carmelized and caramel. Rich, deep, dessert driven yet not just straight sweetness. A nice bitter cocoa, coffee, and dark roasty appeal pulls its weight. Initial is caramel, cream and toffee. Tiramisu like coffee, creaminess and caramel. A rich sweetness hits quickly but ends up sticky but silky as we press on. Rich de leche like flavors, coffee and cocoa. A more potent bitter and roasty appeal helps to balance on the backend. A thickness, sticky appeal, but the sweetness, lactose and richer complex dessert profile meld well together. Its firm but not too thick. Vanilla, espresso, richer coffee appeal at times but overall a bit bitter and toasty as we finish with a bit if caramel and sticky sweetness lingering on. Delicious stuff, more coffee and bitter/roast appeal than the other things Ive had from Ben. But not quite on that flow like German Chocolate. A great nose, pretty pour, rich flavors and nice enough flow. Really nice stuff.

Draft @ CBC 2016. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and coffee aroma. Roasted malty chocolate coffee and vanilla flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate coffee and vanilla finish.
Tap @ CBC2016. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aromas of vanilla, dark fruits, coffee, chocolate, spice, cinnamon. Taste is coffee, fudge, chocolate, vanilla, malt, dark fruits.
CBC. Black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, lacto, wood and spcies. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, lacto, spices, cake, sweet and warming.

Draught @ CBC 2016. Pours black with a small creamy brown head. Aroma of sweet malt, milk chocolate, chocolate cake, vanilla, cocoa, coffee, coffee beans. Flavor is rather sweet, malt, caramel, vanilla, coffee, light spice, cake, some alcohol. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. Nice dessert beer. 130516
Bottle - pours black tan head - nose/taste of vanilla, tiramisu cake, chocolate and cinnamon coffee - medium body.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Biscuit, chocolate, coffee aromas. Biscuit, coffee, chocolate malty sweet Flavors.

Tap @ CBC 2016. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, cocoa, coffee, slight spices, lactose and dark fruits. The taste has lactose, vanilla, caramel, coffee, cocoa and slight spices as well. Sweet but still awesome!

Sampled at on draught at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen, with Holmen1. Pours very dark with a light brown head. Delightful aromas of chocolate and coffee. Taste is very full and velvety with tastes of chocolate, coffee, run, oak, plums and vanilla. All this sweetness is offset by a powerful bitterness, and a good kick of alcohol. Excellent mouthfeel. A really delicious desert beer.

[5/13/16] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Yellow session. Black with a brown head. Amazing aroma with lots of chocolate, cake, vanilla. Sweet flavor with huge chocolate, vanilla, cake, and a bitterish finish. Thick full velvety mouthfeel. Wonderful.

CBC. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, heavy coffee and light vegetables. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 130516

Tap at CBC 2016, yellow session. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Cinnamon notes. Wooden and rum notes. The flavours starts sweet but finish bitter. Full and creamy. Great stuff...

13-MAY-2016, draft @CBC Yellow Session, with Ulkløbben:-)
Black with a low tan head.
Very heavy cacao aroma and taste. Cremey and tasty with a lot of sweetness. OK effort.
Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Black with a thin tan head. Taste is very rich with coffee notes that linger for a long time. Brown bread and tobacco notes in the background. Nice one.

Fra fad på Mikkeller&friends (thanks, Steve!): mørk, mørk brun med flot cappucionskum. Dette er en superb dessertøl md fløjelsblød aroma og smag af fineste chokolade, røde bær, cremefløde, vanilje og kaffe. Flydende tiramisu, simpelthen superlækker.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 - Yellow session. Black color with brown head. Roasted malty aroma, coffee, cocoa, chocolate, fruity. Sweet and light bitter taste, it is a tiramisu coffee stout indeed!! Medium to full silky almost creamy body with soft carbonation.
Tap @ CBC16, Copenhagen. Yellow session. Black pour with tan head. Tons of chocolate, freshly roasted coffee, sweet dark malts and some vanilla.

On tap at CBC 2016, Yellow session. Dissipating espresso head. Black as pitch. Cocoa nose with vanilla sweetness. Mixed taste of dark dough, cocoa and chocolate, a bit oboy like. Slightly roasted dark malty ending with prolonged sweetness. Quite nice in smaller amount like this taster (Copenhagen 13.05.2016).

Sweet and roasted malty aroma and taste, with chocolate, some coffee, caramel, vanilla, sweet malty finish.
Tap @CBC16. Aroma has boose, almonds, vanilla and coffee. Flavour has roast and coffee, dark chocolate. Sticky and sweet Nice.
On tap at CBC 2016. Pitch black with an espresso head. Chocolate, cocoa and vanilla on top of a nice roasty bitterness.

Sample at CBC 2016. My first one from this Brewery. 

Almost black with a tan head. Sweet with chocolate, caramel, coffee and light cocoa. Also something that actually reminded of tiramisu. A dessert beer.

On tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Deep brown with a light chocolate head. Aroma is coffee, biscuit, vanilla, chocolate. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, sweet on the palate. Taste is coffee, chocolate, graham cracker, vanilla.

Yellow session, Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Black beer with a nice beige/brownish head. Chocolae and tiramisu aroma, licorice, caramel, some cocoa and brown sugar. Sweet chocolate flavor, tiramisu, licorice, some milk chocolate,. Really sweet but with well hidden alcohol.
CBC2016. Schwarze Farbe geringe beige Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Schokolade, sehr süß, Vanille. Geschmack süß röstmalzig, Vanille, Pudding, Schokolade, leicht alkoholisch.

@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, YELLOWblack. Really dessertly chocoöate sweetness, malty fudgecake on nose. Full bodied, roasty, malty thick creamy body. Long finish, malty. Really nice beer. Sorta drinkable, super flavours.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is black with very small head. Aromas and flavors: Dark chocolate, chocolate, some sweetness and roasted malts.

Tap@ CBC 2016. Pours black with a thin brown head. Dark chocolate, cocoa powder, roastedness, coffee in aroma. Chocolate mousse, coffee, sweet candy chocolate. Creamy. Vanilla. Excellent dessert beer.
Tap cbc. Pours black with brown head. Aroma of chewy caramel, toffee, nutty, vanilla and biscuits. Taste is heavy sweet, toffe, sweet vanilla, loads vanilla biscuits. Nice

From tap at CBC 2016. Opaque black body. Creamy dense brown head. Cocoa, cinnamon, spices, ripe fruit, roasted malts and coconut in the nose. Some toffee and chocolate. Very nice roasted flavor. Spicy and coconuts. Light cinnamon. Chocolate. Vanilla. Great stuff.

CBC 2016. Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of dark roasted chocolate, coffee, vanilla, biscuits, caramel. Taste is quite sweet with roasted notes and caramel tones. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with low carbonation.
A black beer with brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate, malt, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of chocolate, malt, and caramel, leading to a dry finish.
From tap. Pours hazy dak brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is toasted malty and caramelish. Thick malty, caramelish and chocolate. Lingering toffee and nutty caramelish finish.

Pours black with low tanned head 
Aromas of tiramisu, cinnamon, vanilla, chocolate 
Taste has notes of vanilla, cinnamon, pepper, coffee, chocolate
Keg at cbc16. Dark black... Thin tan lacing.. Dark chocolate roast malts nose.. Rich sweet chocolate roast.. Dark malts... Dark sweet vanilla chocolate roast rich chocolate
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of tiramisu, chocolate and coffee. Taste is chocolate sweet with a light coffee finish. Medium bodied and smooth with soft carbonation.

From notes. Enjoyed this one over at Chriss house on March 26 for a beer and smoked meats get together. 7501 mL bottle cracked open by Chris. Excited for this one. The pour is a lighter black with a darker khaki ring of head that just stays. The aroma is great. There is a ton of chocolate and vanilla. There is a great deal of lactose as well, which Im not too much a can of. The vanilla, cocoa, and even a blast of coffee really do this one right. There is a hint of alcohol on it, but the woodiness and the rum just dont appear. The flavor is excellent as well. Its a little bit all over the place with the sweetness. Vanilla, cocoa, lactose all offer a great presence with a light cinnamon. Its a little messy, but still very good. Just like the nose, there is a missing component of the oak and rum. The mouth feel is excellent. There is a thick chewiness to it with a soft velvety carbonation. Its just beautiful. The chocolate and vanilla that exist on the aftertaste are great. Angry Chair is killing the stout game.

On tap in the tasting room. Pours an opaque brown to almost black. Nose is coffee, dark chocolate and vanilla. Taste follows with just a touch of bitterness on the finish. Great velvety mouth feel. Awesome stout!
really just stunning how good this is. one of the best sweet stouts ive ever had.
